abstract.text: Retrieves the layout attributes of an item when it is being moved interactively by the user.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The index path of the item being moved.
The current position of the item in the collection view’s coordinate system.
The layout attributes of the item while it is at the specified position.

When an item is moving because of user interactivity, the layout object uses this method to retrieve layout attributes to use for the item while it is at the specified position. The default implementation of this method returns a copy of the item’s existing attributes with two changes: the
point is set to the value in
so that the item floats above other items in the collection view.
Subclasses can override this method and modify additional layout attributes as needed. If you override this method, call
first to retrieve the item’s existing attributes and then make your changes to the returned structure.

abstract.text: The maximum value for an `NSInteger`.
Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
An abstract base class for generating layout information for a collection view.
The class to use when creating layout attributes objects.
Retrieves the layout attributes for the specified decoration view.
Retrieves the layout attributes for all of the cells and views in the specified rectangle.
Retrieves the layout attributes of an item when it is being moved interactively by the user.
Retrieves layout information for an item at the specified index path with a corresponding cell.
Retrieves the layout attributes for the specified supplementary view.
Tells the layout object to update the current layout.
Retrieves the content offset to use after an animated layout update or change.
Retrieves the point at which to stop scrolling.
A layout object that manages the layout-related attributes for a given item in a collection view.
The center point of the item.
Specifies the item’s position on the z axis.
A structure that contains a point in a two-dimensional coordinate system.
An object containing a list of indexes that bridges to ; use  when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A list of indexes that together represent the path to a specific location in a tree of nested arrays.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
